section.title: Zzzucchini bread

para.emphasis: This recipe is from my mother's mother's sister, my great aunt Celia Zydowicz Ziemkiewicz. Aunt Celia lived a long and busy life in Cleveland, Ohio. Every October, maybe until she was 90 and I was 40 years old, she came to San Antonio for ten days to visit us and to buy two pairs of shoes (one black pair for winter, one brown pair for summer) from San Antonio Shoemakers. Every time she came, she brought a suitcase full of her baking, including zzzucchini bread wrapped in waxed paper and aluminum foil. I must have been 20 years old before I figured out that zucchini was not a sweet fruit like an apple or a banana, and we actually had plenty in local grocery stores and didn't need to import it from Cleveland. I remember that Celia was quite annoyed at my impatience when I wanted her to tell me the recipe so I could try it myself instead of waiting for her annual visit. She wasn't one for written recipes, preferring to do what works rather than what's written, but she gave me this summary anyway.

listitem.para: 3 T vanilla or as much more as you like
1 C golden raisins (soaked in warm water)

section.para: Beat eggs. Add sugar & oil. Beat until fluffy. Add vanilla. Alternately add zucchini and pineapple & dry ingredients. Add raisins & nuts.
Bake 1 hour in 2 loaf pans, greased & floured.
